body_html:
Great, thank you @Thenerdstation! I realize getting started with TensorFlow development is non-trivial, and there are many small issues like this that collectively would take up a lot of the team's time, so we really appreciate external contributions!

As Derek said, you can detect if you're in a default graph context by checking if _default_graph_stack is empty. This will probably involve adding a new method to the _DefaultGraph class. Don't forget to add a unit test :)

As Derek said, you can detect if you're in a default graph context by checking if _default_graph_stack is empty. This will probably involve adding a new method to the _DefaultGraph class. Don't forget to add a unit test :)
body:
Great, thank you @Thenerdstation! I realize getting started with TensorFlow development is non-trivial, and  there are many small issues like this that collectively would take up a lot of the team's time, so we really appreciate external contributions!

As Derek said, you can detect if you're in a default graph context by checking if `_default_graph_stack` is empty. This will probably involve adding a new method to the `_DefaultGraph` class. Don't forget to add a unit test :)
